summary: This is a Bureau of Prisons clinical encounter record for Jeffrey Epstein dated July 24, 2019, documenting a follow-up visit after an apparent injury. The record notes erythema and abrasions on Epstein's neck, and he insinuates his 'room male' (cellmate) had something to do with the injury but refuses to elaborate.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The inmate and subject of the medical examination. The document records his physical condition, including neck injuries, and his insinuation that his cellmate was involved.

persons.name: MLP
persons.context: The healthcare provider who conducted the initial examination of Epstein, recorded his vital signs, and documented his statements and injuries.

connections.description: MLP conducted a medical examination of inmate Epstein, documenting his injuries and statements.
MD cosigned and reviewed the medical encounter note for Epstein's examination.
MD cosigned the clinical documentation completed by the MLP, indicating a supervisory or review relationship.

events.title: Epstein's Medical Follow-up in Custody
events.description: A follow-up medical encounter for Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (NYM). The examination revealed erythema and abrasions on his neck. Epstein insinuated his cellmate was involved in the injury but refused to discuss details.

keyFacts: On July 24, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein had visible injuries (erythema and abrasions) around his neck during a medical examination in federal custody.
Epstein directly insinuated to medical staff that his 'room male' (cellmate) 'had to do with what happened to me,' but he refused to elaborate or answer further questions.
The medical record documents that Epstein 'does not want to explain how the skin injury on his neck happed [sic]' and was uncooperative on the subject.
The clinical assessment was 'Injury, unspecified' (ICD-10 code T14.90).
The encounter was performed by a Mid-Level Provider (MLP) and later cosigned by a physician (MD).
